page.title: 16Castles
page.content: The castle is one of a series of great castles built during the reign of {Edward 1}to overawe North Wales in the days of Llywelyn,last prince of Wales. The castle was {completed {around 1280.}The castle is concentric, with a low outer wall, inner ward approximately square,set diagonally to the points of the compass,gatehouses with twin towers to the East and West. Despite conservation work which has been undertaken since 1947, the castle appears extensively ruined. Following siege during the Civil War, the castle was intentionally ruined, and became a quarry for building materials. The results can be seen in neighbouring houses. The castle is open to the public from March to October and during July 1985 2,099 adults and 1,192 children and pensioners visited the site.
